DataElement.preferredName: All Tissue Segment Freezing With Optimal Cutting Temperature Compound Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A yes/no response to indicate whether all the surgical tissue segments were frozen with Optimal Cutting Temperature (OCT) embedding media.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: All Tissue Segment Freezing With Optimal Cutting Temperature Compound
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: To a complete degree or to the full or entire extent._An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function._One of the parts into which something naturally divides._The act or event which causes the transition from a liquid to solid matter phase._Used to indicate the presence of something or someone._A solution of water soluble glycols and resins that provide a specimen support matrix for cryostat sectioning at temperatures of -10 degrees C and below.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: To a complete degree or to the full or entire extent.:An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.:One of the parts into which something naturally divides.

Concepts.definition: To a complete degree or to the full or entire extent.
An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.
One of the parts into which something naturally divides.

Property.preferredName: Freezing With Optimal Cutting Temperature Compound
Property.preferredDefinition: The act or event which causes the transition from a liquid to solid matter phase.:Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.:A solution of water soluble glycols and resins that provide a specimen support matrix for cryostat sectioning at temperatures of -10 degrees C and below.

Concepts.definition: The act or event which causes the transition from a liquid to solid matter phase when the temperature is lowered.
Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.
A solution of water soluble glycols and resins that provide a specimen support matrix for cryostat sectioning at temperatures of -10 degrees C and below.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.
